title: Blog from Italy's map
name: Blog from Italy's map
description:
A Map by Alexfromitaly

Blog from Italy's Platial map.

This map will show places related to Blog Posts in Milan and around Italy.

properties.name: A Park
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly  A very nice alternative to Parco Sempione.

properties.name: A good friend
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyThis is where my friend runs his printing business from.

properties.name: Alcatraz - club
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyFancy a boogie? Try here. And try the pizzeria/restaurant next door.

properties.name: Aligia Restaurant - eat well here!
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly A restaurant down in the south of Italy where one can eat very well, according to an Italian friend of mine - Gaetano Salvo.

properties.name: An interesting selection of bars
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly Fancy a drink or a bite to eat? If so, there are several nice bars and a restaurant or two in this area.

properties.name: Anghiari
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly  Not too far from Anghiari, there is the Castello di Sorci, which has its very own resident ghost. Ghost hunting is best done on a full stomach, so why not try the Locanda al Castello di Sorci restaurant, before looking for spooks? - click on the link for details. The Locanda al Castello di Sorci also knows a little about the ghost which haunts the castle in this area. The Italian for ghost is \'fantasma\', by the way.

properties.name: Aquarium,  Parco Sempione, Milan - Free WiFi!
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyThe Aquarium is a place where you can sign up for the Parco Sempione free wifi service.

properties.name: Arcieri del Castello - field archery club, near Milan, Italy
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly  Field archery club near Milan, Italy. English may not be spoken.

properties.name: Arena Civica, Milan
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly  Milan\'s attractive open air Arena - used as a sports and concert venue.

properties.name: Banca Intesa - Avoid this branch
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyAvoid this branch of this Italian bank if you need to carry out any foreign currency transactions. The staff are not particularly competent, not all, but many. And you just will not understand where to go.

properties.name: Bar Magenta
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly Young and trendy Bar, not far from the centre. Pay for your drinks before you go to the bar. This bar is open until 2 or so in the morning.

properties.name: Bar Victoria
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly Chic and upmarket bar - vey nice. Frequented by foreingors and Italians alike. Also check out the restaurant next door - good food. Not that cheap.

properties.name: Brera - nice to wander around
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyExpensive, exclusive and attractive area of Milan. Lots of bars and places to eat and drink.

properties.name: Buccinasco
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyA small residential suburb of Milan. Quiet and green with plenty of amenities.

properties.name: Caldana, Tuscany
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyTry stopping along this road and attempting to photograph the older section of this hilltop village. Early evening on a clear day would be best. The picture should be well worthwhile, as the place looks magical in early evening light. Caldana itself is OK, but nothing special, however there is always the annual \'Wild boar\' annual summer fair which takes place towards the end of August. A good way to try will boar meat if ever there was one, and some good local plonk.

properties.name: Carabinieri - Police station
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalySomeone stolen your passport? Report it here.

properties.name: Castiglione della Pescara, Tuscany, Italy.
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyNice, relatively quiet Italian seaside resort. The older area above the harbour and near the castle is very picturesque. And check out the cruises to the islands of Giglio and Gianutri. Both are worth exploring - in fact you can stay on Giglio and it is certainly worth spending a few days there.

properties.name: Cormons - where Gianpietro Carlesso is based.
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly Cormons is where interesting Italian sculptor Gianpietro Carlesso is based. The photo shows an example of his work. If you ever find yourself in the area -look him up!

properties.name: Fiera Milano - out of town location
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyThis is the complex which houses Milan\'s major trade fairs and exhibitions, although some fairs are held at the other site close to the centre of Milan. Easy to reach using Milan\'s red underground railway line.

properties.name: Fiera Milano City
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly Milan\'s main exhibition and trade fair site. Easy to reach via Milan\'s red underground railway line. Get off at the Amendola Fiera stop.

properties.name: Former Location of Milan's Oh Bej Fair
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly

properties.name: Four Four Two Pub - with Beamish in Milan
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly  This is a nice pub that has Beamish stout and other UK beers. Scottish/English football and sports themes. I pop in here from time to time for a quick pint. Even runs a pub quiz.

properties.name: Good photographic equipment shop
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly Need something for your camera? Try here - not sure they speak English, but they are competent and friendly. Well stocked to.

properties.name: Great beach near Castiglione, Tuscany, Italy.
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly  Unbelievable but true, this sandy beach with its shallow sea is not choc a block crowded like most other beaches in August in Italy. It\'s a good place for kids, and you can even get an ice cream from the quad bike which wanders along the beach. But watch out for strong currents which can whip you out to sea when the sea is rough - and there are no lifeguards.

properties.name: Hosptial with a casualty department
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly This hospital is the one nearest the centre of Milan. Go there if you feel ill.

properties.name: Il Castello - the castle
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyMilan\'s castle and museum. Worth a look and a wander around.

properties.name: Il Quadrifoglio - Great Food!
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly A great little restaurant in Milan - excellent service, interesting menu, and reasonable, though not cheap (c€40/head), prices. Nice atmosphere too. Recommended!

properties.name: Isola del Giglio, Tuscany, Italy.
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyLovely little island not far off the Tuscan coast. Well worth a visit - you can get a ferry there, but a motorbike would be better than a car - the roads are narrow and ten cars meeting at once can cause one almighty traffic jam apparently!

properties.name: Isola di Gianutri, Tuscany, Italy.
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyBeautiful virtually uninhabited little island - the restaurant/cafe is a little pricey. Used to be a Roman resort and the the remains of a vast villa which could house up to 1000 people are worth a visit (through a hole in a fence on the left of the main entrance - but I did not tell you). Have a swim in the mini-bay to cool off. I could happily have spent a day exploring the place. Boat trips or boats for hire from Giglio are possibly the best way to get there.

properties.name: Italian in-laws
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyThis is the street in which my Italian in-laws reside.

properties.name: La Francesca - Holiday Chalets
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly This is where we went for a short break. It\'s about here.

properties.name: La Miniera - Ravi, Tuscany
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyWhere I spent week two of my hols in 2007. Converted mine managers house divided into 6 appartments. There is also a small bungalow. And then there is the pool. Good place. Generally very quiet.

properties.name: Lake Nemi - Ghosts, A temples to the goddess Diana and Roman Ships
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly   A lake not far from Rome known for the Temple of Diana, ghosts around the temple area, and Roman ships. See the Roman Ships museum in Nemi for more details.

properties.name: Location of the Paolo Sarpi food and wine fair 2007
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly

properties.name: Me, in Milan
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyThe street in which I reside

properties.name: Milan's Duomo
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyThe impressive cathedral in central Milan.

properties.name: Naviglio - Canal area of Milan
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyThis is the start of the Naviglio area in Milan. Lots of bars and places open during the August shutdown.

properties.name: New Golf accessory shop here!
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly  The shop is open and can be found at at Via Procaccini, 20.

properties.name: Nola - Gigli Festival
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly  Every year, in June, in this Italian town, not far from Naples, a spectacular festival is held. Apart from the procession, this is also music and dancing.

properties.name: Oria - mysterious fog!
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly   As legend has it, this southern Italian town is surrounded by a fog which springs up all of a sudden from the ground. A result of killing the witches daughter to build the town\'s walls.

properties.name: Parco Esposizioni Novegro
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly    Novegro Exhibition Park - Milan

properties.name: Parco Sempione, Milan - Free WiFi!
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly    The City of Milan\'s main park. Well kept, green and pleasant. An oasis of peace in the centre of the city.

properties.name: Pisa, Italy - watch out!!
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyQuite a few people have been caught out by the restricted traffic zone in this famous Italian city. Be careful about entering the centre of the city by car - even if you have a hotel booking - this does not seem to provide protection....

properties.name: Ravi, Tuscany
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyVery small hilltop former mining village. Not much there, but the views are great and the central ex-castle area is enchanting, if a little small.

properties.name: Sant'Eustachio Cafè
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly  The Sant\'Eustachio Cafè down in Rome is something of a legend. This mythical coffee house located in Piazza Sant\'Eustachio should be something of a Mecca for all lovers of Italian coffee.

properties.name: Stazione Centrale - Central Station
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyThe place you will most likely arrive if you come by Train, from Switzerland for example. Hop on the Yellow underground line and get off at the Duomo stop.

properties.name: The Duomo underground stop - Milan.
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyAlthough not indicated on the map, there is the Duomo stop here on the yellow line of the metro.

properties.name: Traffic fine - Pisa
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyVia Giovanni di Simone - within restricted traffic area Someone who drove in Pisa received a fine while driving down this road.

properties.name: Unicredit Banca - cash machine
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyUse this ATM to get some cash before splashing it in nearby Via Monte Napoleone.

properties.name: Very good bathroom accessory shop
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly If you want to add a little Italian style to your bathroom, check out this shop. Very nice shop and very good presentation. Prices are average for Milan.

properties.name: Via Monte Napoleone
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyGot money to burn on designer labels? Yes. Then spend some time, and money here!

properties.name: Villetta/Bungalow, near Ravi, Tuscany
properties.description: Posted by AlexfromitalyWonderful 3 bed bungalow with a lovely covered veranda. Dishwasher, washing machine, heating and barbecue. Very, very quiet, despite the road which passes it. We had a wonderful time here for a week in August 2007.

properties.name: Zelig Cabaret Venue, Viale Monza, 140, Milan
properties.description: Posted by Alexfromitaly

properties.name: australian embassy
properties.description: Posted by SystemVia Antonio Bosio, 5, Rome
